info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 2 at 5:23PM AST until May 2 at 7:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Yauco.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM AST.
* IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain is decreasing. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Also, USGS river sensors indicate that Rio Loco water levels are elevated, very close to reach minor flood stage. Therefore, a Flood Warning will be issued for areas along Rio Loco. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AST THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
